===Etymology===
First appears in Japanese in the 1713 edition of the [[w:Wakan Sansai Zue|{{lang|ja|和漢三才図会}}]] (''Wakan Sansai Zue'', “Illustrated Sino-Japanese Encyclopedia”).  Appears to be a Japanese coinage as {{m|ja|亜|tr=a||next, sub-}} + {{m|ja|鉛|tr=en||lead|pos=the metal}}, probably from the way that zinc is often found together with lead in [[ore]]s.  Probably influenced by early {{etyl|nan|ja|sort=あえん}} {{m|zh|倭鉛|tr=e iân}}, early {{etyl|cmn|ja|sort=あえん}} {{m|zh|倭鉛|tr=wōqiān|lit=dwarf lead” → “zinc}}.
